rm_classifier.helpers.cluster_performance_metrics module

Functions to Evaluate Clustering Performance on Predicted Clusters and Known Malfunctions Labels

Author: Johann Luca Kastner Date: 15/09/2025 License: MIT

rm_classifier.helpers.cluster_performance_metrics.get_main_malfunction(contingency_table)[source]

Get the malfunction that is most represented in each cluster

Parameters:

contingency_table (pd.DataFrame) – contingency table with clusters as index and malfunctions as columns

Returns:

malfunction that is most represented in each cluster

Return type:

pd.Series

rm_classifier.helpers.cluster_performance_metrics.get_main_cluster(contingency_table)[source]

Get the cluster that is most represented for each malfunction

Parameters:

contingency_table (pd.DataFrame) – contingency table with clusters as index and malfunctions as columns

Returns:

cluster that is most represented for each malfunction

Return type:

pd.Series

rm_classifier.helpers.cluster_performance_metrics.get_malfunction_separability(contingency_table)[source]

Get the separability of each malfunction separability = sum_i (n_i^2 / N_i) / M where n_i is the number of events from the malfunction in cluster i, N_i is the total number of events in cluster i, and M is the total number of events from the malfunction

Parameters:

contingency_table (pd.DataFrame) – contingency table with clusters as index and malfunctions as columns

Returns:

separability of each malfunction

Return type:

pd.Series

rm_classifier.helpers.cluster_performance_metrics.get_cluster_purity(contingency_table)[source]

Get the purity of each cluster purity = sum_j (n_j^2 / N) / N where n_j is the number of events from malfunction j in the cluster, N is the total number of events in the cluster

Parameters:

contingency_table (pd.DataFrame) – contingency table with clusters as index and malfunctions as columns

Returns:

purity of each cluster

Return type:

pd.Series

rm_classifier.helpers.cluster_performance_metrics.get_cluster_fraction_of_dominant_malfunction(contingency_table)[source]

rm_classifier.helpers.cluster_performance_metrics.get_malfunction_fraction_of_dominated_clusters(contingency_table)[source]

Fraction of the malfunction in the clusters which are dominated by the malfunction

Parameters:

contingency_table (pd.DataFrame) – contingency table with clusters as index and malfunctions as columns

Returns:

fraction of the malfunction in the clusters which are dominated by this malfunction

Return type:

pd.Series

rm_classifier.helpers.cluster_performance_metrics.get_malfunction_accuracy(contingency_table)[source]

Accuracy/Efficiency, i.e. the fraction of the events from a malfunction which are mapped into a cluster which is dominated by the malfunction

Parameters:

contingency_table (pd.DataFrame) – contingency table with clusters as index and malfunctions as columns

Returns:

accuracy of each malfunction

Return type:

pd.Series

rm_classifier.helpers.cluster_performance_metrics.get_malfunction_number_of_relevant_clusters(contingency_table, threshold=100)[source]

Fraction of the events from a malfunction which are mapped into a cluster which is dominated by the malfunction

Parameters:

  • contingency_table (pd.DataFrame) – contingency table with clusters as index and malfunctions as columns

  • threshold (int) – minimum number of events from the malfunction in the cluster to be considered relevant

Returns:

number of relevant clusters for each malfunction

Return type:

pd.Series
